Class SolarSystem

java.lang.Object
java.awt.Component
java.awt.Container
java.awt.Window
java.awt.Frame
javax.swing.JFrame
SolarSystem
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants
public class SolarSystem
extends javax.swing.JFrame
This class provides a graphical user interface to a model of the solar system
See Also:
Serialized Form

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    SolarSystem​(int width, int height)
    Create a view of the Solar System.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description

    Draws a round shape in the window at the given co-ordinates that represents an object in the solar system.

    Draws a round shape in the window at the given co-ordinates.
    void finishedDrawing()
    Updates the window to show all objects that have recently been drawn using drawSolarObject() or drawSolarObjectAbout().

  • Constructor Details

    • SolarSystem

      public SolarSystem​(int width, int height)
      Create a view of the Solar System. Once an instance of the SolarSystem class is created, a window of the appropriate size is displayed, and objects can be displayed in the solar system
      Parameters:
      width - the width of the window in pixels.
      height - the height of the window in pixels.

  • Method Details

    • drawSolarObject

      public void drawSolarObject​(double distance, double angle, double diameter, java.lang.String col)
      Draws a round shape in the window at the given co-ordinates that represents an object in the solar system. The SolarSystem class uses Polar Co-ordinates to represent the location of objects in the solar system.
      Parameters:
      distance - the distance from the sun to the object.
      angle - the angle (in degrees) that represents how far the planet is around its orbit of the sun.
      diameter - the size of the object.
      col - the colour of this object, as a string. Case insentive.

      One of: BLACK, BLUE, CYAN, DARK_GRAY, GRAY, GREEN, LIGHT_GRAY, MAGENTA, ORANGE, PINK, RED, WHITE, YELLOW. Alternatively, a 24 bit hexadecimal string representation of an RGB colour is also accepted, e.g. "#FF0000"

    • drawSolarObjectAbout

      public void drawSolarObjectAbout​(double distance, double angle, double diameter, java.lang.String col, double centreOfRotationDistance, double centreOfRotationAngle)
      Draws a round shape in the window at the given co-ordinates. The SolarSystem class uses Polar Co-ordinates to represent the location of objects in the solar system. This method operates in the same fashion as drawSolarObject, but provides additional co-ordinates to allow the programmer to use an arbitrary point about which the object orbits (e.g. a planet rather than the sun).
      Parameters:
      distance - the distance from this object to the point about which it is orbiting.
      angle - the angle (in degrees) that represents how far the object is around its orbit.
      diameter - the size of the object.
      col - the colour of this object, as a string. Case insentive.

      One of: BLACK, BLUE, CYAN, DARK_GRAY, GRAY, GREEN, LIGHT_GRAY, MAGENTA, ORANGE, PINK, RED, WHITE, YELLOW. Alternatively, a 24 bit hexadecimal string representation of an RGB colour is also accepted, e.g. "#FF0000"

      centreOfRotationDistance - the distance part of the polar co-ordinate about which this object orbits.
      centreOfRotationAngle - the angular part of the polar co-ordinate about which this object orbits.

    • finishedDrawing

      public void finishedDrawing()
      Updates the window to show all objects that have recently been drawn using drawSolarObject() or drawSolarObjectAbout(). The method also waits for 20 milliseconds (1/50th of one second) and then clears the screen.
